com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.sessions

Interface DocumentSession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComparativeCheckCallback, CorrectionDialogCheckCallback, CorrectionDialogCheckSession, DocumentSessionControllerProvider, InlineCheckCallback, InlineCheckSession, MarkingStore, PrepareCheckCallback, PrepareRecheckCallback, RecheckSession, TagListProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentSessionImpl

    public interface DocumentSession
extends InlineCheckSession, DocumentSessionControllerProvider, CorrectionDialogCheckSession, RecheckSession, ComparativeCheckCallback, TagListProvider
    The DocumentSession represents all needed information of a host applications document by the Acrolinx Java SDK. You could implement a DocumentSession your self or use the GuiFactory.documentSessions(), which splits the implementation into useful chunks and already implements common behavior.

        static final DocumentSession NULL

    • Method Detail

      • isCaretOnMarking

        boolean isCaretOnMarking()
        Returns:
        true, if the caret is on a marking.

      • popupContextMenuOnCaret

        void popupContextMenuOnCaret()
        Pops up the context menu for the marking at the current caret.

      • setGuiUpdateListener

        void setGuiUpdateListener(GuiUpdateListener guiUpdateListener)
        Sets the GuiUpdateListener for the DocumentSession. Normally this will be done automatically by creation of GuiController via GuiFactory. In case you manage your DocumentSessions without DocumentSessionController and DocumentSessionControllerProvider you might have to call this method manually.
        Parameters:
        guiUpdateListener - The GuiUpdateListener which should be notified after a context menu command has finished.
